body_html:
Yup. So it looks like the Makefile build rules are finding the wrong header file to include while building.

cat tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile | grep HASH
EIGEN_HASH := d02e6a705c30
-I$(MAKEFILE_DIR)/downloads/eigen-eigen-$(EIGEN_HASH) \
-I$(MAKEFILE_DIR)/downloads/eigen-eigen-$(EIGEN_HASH) \

cat tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh | grep HASH
EIGEN_HASH=d02e6a705c30
curl "https://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen/get/${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz" \
-o /tmp/eigen-${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz
tar xzf /tmp/eigen-${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz -C ${DOWNLOADS_DIR}

But:

cat third_party/eigen3/Eigen/Core 
#include "eigen-eigen-0c0b79ecd74c/Eigen/Core"

EDIT: Added details;

body:
Yup. So it looks like the `Makefile` build rules are finding the wrong header file to include while building.

```
cat tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile | grep HASH
EIGEN_HASH := d02e6a705c30
-I$(MAKEFILE_DIR)/downloads/eigen-eigen-$(EIGEN_HASH) \
-I$(MAKEFILE_DIR)/downloads/eigen-eigen-$(EIGEN_HASH) \
```

```
cat tensorflow/contrib/makefile/download_dependencies.sh | grep HASH
EIGEN_HASH=d02e6a705c30
curl "https://bitbucket.org/eigen/eigen/get/${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz" \
-o /tmp/eigen-${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz
tar xzf /tmp/eigen-${EIGEN_HASH}.tar.gz -C ${DOWNLOADS_DIR}

```

But:

```
cat third_party/eigen3/Eigen/Core 
#include "eigen-eigen-0c0b79ecd74c/Eigen/Core"
```

**EDIT:** Added details;
